item.title: UFO Sighting Over Kanchenjunga ‚Äì Mystery Above the Himalayas
item.description: The towering Kanchenjunga, the world’s third-highest mountain, has long been surrounded by myths, spirituality, and intrigue. Rising over 8,500 meters across the borders of India and Nepal, it’s revered as a sacred peak by the people of Sikkim. item.title: RCB, Alcohol Ownership, and the Public Spectacle: A Modern-Colosseum Distraction?

item.title: Water for Pakistan: Lifeline, Dependency, and the Shifting Control
item.description: Water is not just a natural resource for Pakistan—it is its lifeline. With over 90% of its water supply coming from a single river system, Pakistan is critically dependent on external sources. Agriculture, power generation, and daily life across the country rely on uninterrupted water flow, primarily from rivers originating in Indian-administered territory. In recent developments, however, t
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Vimanas in Ancient India ‚Äì Were They Real Flying Machines?
item.description: The idea of Vimanas, ancient flying machines mentioned in Indian scriptures, has fascinated historians, scientists, and enthusiasts alike. Some believe these texts describe advanced aerial technology far ahead of their time, while others argue that Vimanas are purely mythological. But could ancient India have actually possessed flying technology, or are these references symbolic? Let’s explo
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.description: Garam masala is a quintessential spice blend used in Indian cuisine. item.description: Samosas are a popular savory snack originating from the Indian subcontinent. item.title: What percentage of Indians are vegetarian?
item.description: Approximately 30-40% of the population in India is estimated to follow a vegetarian diet. However, this percentage can vary depending on the region, cultural practices and religious beliefs. item.title: INS Vikrant Delivered to Indian Navy, First Indigenous Aircraft Carrier by India
item.description: INS Vikrant which is also known as Indigenous Aircraft Carrier 1 (IAC-1). It is the first aircraft carrier to be built in India. This is an Aircraft Carrier constructed by the Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) for the Indian Navy. The name Vikrant means courageous in Sanskrit. item.title: Monkeypox Outbreak around the World in 2022
item.description: The outbreak of monkeypox, which is a viral disease, was confirmed in May 2022, once few cases were found in the United Kingdom. The first case was detected on 6th May 2022 and confirmed this case had travel links to Nigeria (where the disease is endemic). item.title: Prime accused in gang-rape case nabbed after two decades
item.description: Prime accused Bibekananda Biswal in a sensational gangrape that shook Odisha in its aftermath in 1999 is now caught by Police from Aamby Valley in Lonavala in Maharashtra. item.title: International Mother Language Day
item.description: International Mother Language Day is a worldwide annual observance held on 21st February to promote awareness of linguistic and cultural diversity and to promote multilingualism. item.title: National Education Policy 2020, Government of India (NEP 2020)
item.description: National Education Policy (NEP 2020) has been approved by Union Cabinet on 29 July 2020. Its major aim is to introduce changes in the Indian Education System right from the school to the college level of education. Making India a Global Knowledge Superpower is the ultimate objective of the NEP 2020. It is the third major change in education systems in India since independence in 1947. Earlier two
